justification: B is said to like deep threats, but the offer ignores B’s injury caution and youth/ascending preference; Adams is a doubtful veteran in a low-volume offense. A already has a healthy Tier-2 TE and avoids injuries, yet targets a doubtful Tier-5 TE—contrary to A’s ceiling-chasing urgency. The rationale is brief and inaccurate (“steady TE”), missing key roster and health context. Some ToM appears (B can start the rookie TE), but overall reasoning and fit are poor.
